title: Store your files in complete privacy
subtitle: Internxt Drive is a zero-knowledge file storage service that's based on absolute privacy and uncompromising security.
subtitle2: Sign up and get 10 GB for free, forever!

title: One plan for all our services.
subtitle: Get more out of Internxt with our all in one membership that allows you to use one storage plan across all our services.

title: Designed to protect your privacy.
subtitle: Your uploaded files are client-side encrypted and then fragmented into small pieces.
subtitle2: Only you hold your decryption key which retrieves your fragmented files.
subtitle_sm: Your uploaded files are client-side encrypted and then fragmented into small pieces.

title: Your data is yours to share.
subtitle: Services like Dropbox, Google Drive, Microsoft OneDrive and Apple iCloud all have permission to access your data.
subtitle2: Internxt Drive features zero-knowledge encryption, meaning that only you can ever access your files.

title: Secure. Private. Simple to use.
subtitle: A functional and intuitive interface with a variety of different customizations and features, such as encrypted file sharing.
subtitle3: The files you keep secure on Internxt Drive are easy to get to.
subtitle4: Access your files from our desktop app, Web browser app and our iOS or Android app.

title: Your Business in your hands.
subtitle: Internxt Drive for teams allows you and your team to store files with total security, collaborate privately with other members and toggle your administration features.

title: Is cloud the answer?
subtitle: “A recent survey from Deloitte shows that blockchain-based cloud storage is picking up steam.
subtitle2: It’s simply a smarter way to take advantage of emerging technology and all that cloud has to offer: reliability, security and scalability. Deloitte survey reveals strong investment in blockchain.”
subtitle3: “The research investigates the impact of distributed and centralized cloud architectures on security.
subtitle4: Centralized clouds interlace core functions within the same space. If an error or attack manages to destabilize a centralized component, the entire cloud is at risk.”
